sentences: Nagi Jamal Omar (born 16 December 1986 in Tumba), better known as simply Nano, is a Swedish singer and songwriter.
section: N/A

sentences: He first came to prominence while competing in Melodifestivalen 2017.
section: N/A
== Life and career ==

sentences: Life and career ==

sentences: Early life and personal life =
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and personal life ===
== Life and career == | === Early life and personal life ===

sentences: Omar was born on 16 December 1986 in Tumba, Botkyrka, Stockholm.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and personal life ===

sentences: His father is Palestinian, while his mother is from Åland.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and personal life ===

sentences: At age 12, he moved to a foster home in Gotland.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and personal life ===

sentences: When his mother visited him for the first time since moving in, she gave him a synthesizer, which influenced his decision to focus on music.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and personal life ===

sentences: He was arrested at age 18, and went to jail.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and personal life ===

sentences: When he was 21, he ended up in jail once again and thereafter was also informed that his girlfriend was pregnant with their child; Because of this, he decided to focus on his family and resume his musical career.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and personal life ===

sentences: He currently lives with his partner and four children in Södertälje.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and personal life ===

sentences: === 2015–present: Career breakthrough and Melodifestivalen 2017 =
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Career breakthrough and Melodifestivalen 2017 ===
== Life and career == | === 2015–present: Career breakthrough and Melodifestivalen 2017 ===

sentences: In the spring of 2015, he released his debut single "Lion".
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Career breakthrough and Melodifestivalen 2017 ===

sentences: In 2017, he began competing in Melodifestivalen 2017, the Swedish national selection for the Eurovision Song Contest 2017 with the song "Hold On".
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Career breakthrough and Melodifestivalen 2017 ===

sentences: He progressed directly to the final from the first-semi-final.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Career breakthrough and Melodifestivalen 2017 ===

sentences: In the final he placed second overall, being the winner of the televoting and second in the jury voting.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Career breakthrough and Melodifestivalen 2017 ===

sentences: He participated in Melodifestivalen 2019 with the song "Chasing Rivers".
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–present: Career breakthrough and Melodifestivalen 2017 ===
